In 2012, Pep Segura, technical manager at LFCs academy, left the club after previously being told he'd earned a promotion. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Before Brendan Rodgers arrived, John Henry & Segura held a meeting and decided that Segura would become sporting director. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Rodgers, though, had other ideas, insisting his own appointment would not involve another tier of management above him. (@Simon_Hughes__)

For Segura there was embarrassment when he arrived at Melwood for pre-season to find out there would be no place for him. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Segura was angry that he found out this way & resigned on the spot. The announcement was made a month later. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Now Barcelona's general manager, it is said that Segura has made taking Coutinho from Liverpool a personal mission. (@Simon_Hughes__)

It is said he would like nothing better than to expose FSG’s collective stance over Coutinho’s future as total mush. (@Simon_Hughes__)

In 2012, Pep Segura, technical manager at LFCs academy, left the club after previously being told he'd earned a promotion. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Before Brendan Rodgers arrived, John Henry & Segura held a meeting and decided that Segura would become sporting director. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Rodgers, though, had other ideas, insisting his own appointment would not involve another tier of management above him. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Segura was angry that he found out this way & resigned on the spot. The announcement was made a month later. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Now Barcelona's general manager, it is said that Segura has made taking Coutinho from Liverpool a personal mission. (@Simon_Hughes__)

It is said he would like nothing better than to expose FSG’s collective stance over Coutinho’s future as total mush. (@Simon_Hughes__)

Jurgen Klopp has dismissed as “nonsense” speculation that Liverpool are planning a January swoop for Arsenal’s Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.

Reports suggested that the Reds were preparing to bid around £20million for the England international, who only has 18 months remaining on his contract with the Gunners.


“Usually I don’t say anything about transfer rumours, but I can make an exception, no problem,” he said.

“This is nonsense. From my side, there’s nothing else to say about it.”

Jurgen Klopp has dismissed as “nonsense” speculation that Liverpool are planning a January swoop for Arsenal’s Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.

Reports suggested that the Reds were preparing to bid around £20million for the England international, who only has 18 months remaining on his contract with the Gunners.


“Usually I don’t say anything about transfer rumours, but I can make an exception, no problem,” he said.

“This is nonsense. From my side, there’s nothing else to say about it.”
